contactDescription: Get in touch with our team. We are here to help!
emailDescription: Send us an email and we will get back to you within 24 hours.
supportDescription: Chat with our support team on Telegram for instant help.
followUsDescription: Stay updated with our latest news and updates.
faqDescription: Find answers to common questions about Lendower.
faq1Question: How do I create a group?
faq1Answer: Click on the "Add Group" button and fill in the group details.
faq2Answer: Go to Settings > Friends and use the "Add Friend" option.
faq3Answer: Yes, we use industry-standard encryption to protect your data.
versionDescription: Version information and changelog for Lendower
changelogDescription: Complete list of changes and improvements
lockGroupDescription: In a locked group, you cannot add new members or expenses
finishGroupDescription: A finished group has no unsettled balances and is not included in overall expenses
simplifyDebtsDescription: This feature will reduce the number of unnecessary payments between group members
simplifyDebtsWarning: If you enable simplified debts for the group, you cannot revert this action!
allSettledUpDescription: You don't owe anyone and no one owes you.
simplificationAdded: Added simplification for groups. Now all groups have optimized number of payments between members.
splitTypeInfoDescription: Choose how you want to split the expense among participants
splitTypeEqualDescription: The expense is divided equally among all selected participants. Everyone pays the same amount.
splitTypeCustomDescription: You manually specify the exact amount for each participant. The sum of all shares must equal the total expense amount.
splitTypePercentageDescription: The expense is split by percentages you specify for each participant. The sum of all percentages must equal 100%.
splitTypeSharesDescription: The expense is split proportionally to the number of shares each participant has. For example, if one participant has 2 shares and another has 1, the first will pay twice as much.
splitTypeExtraDescription: First, the expense is divided equally among everyone. Then you can add extra amounts for individual participants. The remaining participants automatically pay less so the total amount stays the same. Example: expense 600 for 2 people, one adds 50 - they pay 350, the other 250.
